p: 5. The authors mention the higher odds of being HBsAg positive and higher odds of infectivity and state that “Men should be a major focus of HBV elimination strategies in Africa”, but what are the consequences of this for women and children? I am not sure how they propose to do this given the reported gender-based disparity in access to healthcare that already exists in developing countries. The authors address correlates of HBV infection but fail to take marital status into account.
